author: Evan Newton
title: NCSO hosts 2nd annual art exhibit - The Covington News
text: Art often is used as a way to tell a story. It is a way to creatively express one’s self despite whatever trials and tribulations that someone may be going through. On Dec. 21, students of the Newton County Sheriff’s Office art program got to tell their stories in the 2nd annual NCSO art exhibit. Family and friends were on hand as inmate residents got to tell their stories through their artwork and the meaning and significance behind them. NCSO workforce development program coordinator Tongela Smith hosted the event. Smith said that hosting an event like this allows the talents of the inmate-residents to shine. “To offer an opportunity for several gifted individuals to come together and share their talents – as we are going to share their talents with you all today – I am so excited to be in the midst of so many gifted people,” Smith said. “I’m blessed to see the talents that are displayed upon these tables.” For the second time, Dr. Zerric Clinton was the teacher behind the art program. Clinton has been an art teacher for 29 years and has had his work featured on a number of exhibits as well as with the Atlanta Hawks Foundation and State Farm collaboration. Clinton, who taught the inmate-residents virtually, was excited to see the final pieces presented in person. “[I’m] just really elated to see the pieces in person, Clinton said. “I’ve seen them on the screen but it’s very different when you see them in person.” The artists then got a chance to come up one-by-one and present their artwork. Each artist presented two finished pieces that they got to complete during their time in the art program. Jody Reid drew a piece of cheese for one of his two pieces of artwork.. While this may seem elementary on the surface, the details are what really makes the piece stand out. The cheese is fully finished at the top, halfway in the middle and barely filled in at the bottom. His two children's names were also in the drawing. For Reid it’s all about perspective. “[At the top] I can see where I want to go, I know where I want to be, and if I stay focused I’ll get there,” Reid said. “In the middle, it ain’t always where I want to be, but I got a good picture of where I’m trying to go. And then at the bottom, it may be a rough start… but stay focused and push forward and something good’s gonna come from it.” Arnithal Freeman drew a waterfall and a 1965 Ford Mustang. Freeman said his drawings were meant to keep him at ease during the stressful times and to remember the good times. “Even though we’re all here, you have to do something with your mind to relax you – and everyone loves waterfalls,” Freeman said. “The ‘65 Mustang, I think all Americans are in love with their car. It was something to do at home and it was a good thing that I can remember.” Herbert Little drew two pieces, with one called “in-between.” The picture features a girl who seems normal on the outside, but has a troubled history kept on the insid It is meant to provide viewers a reminder of a commonly heard message. “The girl [in the picture] is a little girl but she looks kind of dark – but it’s not to judge a book by its cover,” Little said. “Sometimes it can look the same way [as someone] but be totally different on the inside.” On the floor with the other pieces of artwork from the students, was Clinton’s own piece called “Mother’s Protection.” The piece is part of an abstract art series, with this piece resembling that of a mother protecting her child. In all, Clinton thanked all of the students for participating in the program and encouraged the students to keep pursuing art. We know that those pictures represent more than just the drawing or painting, but it represents something that’s inside – and that’s what makes it worthwhile.NCSO chaplain James Walden Sheriff Ezell Brown was also in attendance for the event. Brown thanked everyone who attended on behalf of the students and showed his gratitude toward Clinton. The Sheriff particularly commended Clinton on his ability to teach the class virtually and do it effectively. Brown said it speaks to the type of teacher that Clinton is. “Anyone that can tell someone, show someone how to create art from afar – they must have talent that is beyond my comprehension,” Brown said. “I thank you [Clinton] for providing that gift to our residents.” According to Brown, the tentative plan is to display the artwork in a number of county buildings, and that the NCSO would work with the local governments to try to make that happen. NCSO chaplain James Walden was also on hand to give the opening and closing prayers. Letting the residents know how proud he was of them was also of the top of priorities for Walden, as he left the students with some closing thoughts. “We are definitely proud of each one of you,” Walden said. "We know that those pictures represent more than just the drawing or painting, but it represents something that’s inside – and that’s what makes it worthwhile.”

author: خبرگزاری تسنیم | Tasnim
title: هشدار به مشتریان بانکی؛ بدافزارها در پوشش به روزرسانی «بام» و «بله» فعال شده اند - تسنیم
text:
هشدار به مشتریان بانکی؛ بدافزارها در پوشش بهروزرسانی «بام» و «بله» فعال شدهاند
بانک ملی ایران با صدور اطلاعیهای رسمی از شگرد جدید مجرمان سایبری پرده برداشت؛ بدافزارهایی که با عنوان بهروزرسانی سامانههای «بام» و «بله» منتشر شده و با فریب کاربران، اطلاعات بانکی و پیامکهای خصوصی آنان را سرقت میکنند.
به گزارش خبرگزاری تسنیم، بانک ملی ایران با صدور اطلاعیه ای رسمی تأکید کرد: افراد سودجو با ایجاد کانالهایی در پیامرسانها تحت عنوان «باشگاه مشتریان بانک ملی» و «باشگاه بام بانک ملی» و طرح ادعاهایی نظیر ضرورت بهروزرسانی خدمات، نصب نسخه جدید همراهبانک یا فعالسازی حساب کاربری بام، کاربران را ترغیب به دریافت و نصب نرمافزارهای آلوده میکنند.
بر اساس اعلام بانک، مجرمان سایبری در این شیوه با ارسال پیوندهای حاوی بدافزار تحت عنوان «باشگاه بام»، به اطلاعات بانکی و پیامکهای خصوصی کاربران دسترسی یافته و از این طریق اقدام به برداشت غیرمجاز از حسابهای بانکی آنان میکنند.
بانک ملی ایران تأکید کرده است نسخه اصلی و معتبر نرمافزارهای «بام» و «بله» فقط از طریق وبسایت رسمی این بانک قابل دریافت است و مشتریان باید از نصب هرگونه نرمافزار دریافتی از منابع غیررسمی یا ناشناس خودداری کنند.
همچنین از شهروندان خواسته شده است در صورت دریافت پیوندهای مشکوک، قبل از باز کردن یا کلیک کردن، آنها را حذف کرده تا از سوءاستفاده احتمالی جلوگیری شود.

author: Ana Carolina Stobbe
title: MEIs representam 79,5% das empresas abertas no primeiro trimestre de 2025
text: O Rio Grande do Sul registrou um recorde de empresas abertas no primeiro trimestre do ano , registrando 84.505 novos empreendimentos. Delas, a grande maioria são formadas pelos microempreendedores individuais (MEIs): 67.212, que representam 79,5% do total . A categoria, criada em 2008, oferece benefícios e facilidades no registro, conquistando os pequenos empresários. Os dados foram compilados pela Secretaria Estadual de Desenvolvimento (Sedec) através da Junta Comercial, Industrial e Serviços do Rio Grande do Sul (JucisRS). De acordo com a presidente da JucisRS, Lauren Momback Mazardo, há um conjunto de questões que explicam o crescimento de MEIs no Rio Grande do Sul . Em especial, considera como fator decisivo o ambiente de negócios estabelecido por políticas públicas promovidas pelo governo estadual. Entre elas, a presidente da Junta Comercial ressalta o InvestRS, a agência de investimentos do Estado, lançada no final de 2024. “Hoje, a gente vê que o cenário está muito favorável, que as pessoas querem investir no estado do Rio Grande do Sul, que é bom viver aqui no nosso estado, que está bom para investir e tem muitas políticas públicas voltadas para o empreendedor, inclusive para os MEIs”, avalia Lauren. Já a analista de relacionamento responsável por MEIs do Sebrae-RS Giulia Mattos, reflete que o aumento das MEIs é um fenômeno nacional . “Não é uma novidade, mas uma tendência. É legal lembrar que nos últimos anos, os governos (federal, estadual e municipal) em parceria com outras instituições, inclusive com o Sebrae, tiraram do papel projetos muito importantes, como a nota fiscal eletrônica (NFS-e). E as MEIs vieram para ficar”, explica. A multiplicação das MEIs também tem como plano de fundo a Reforma Trabalhista , aprovada em 2017. A partir dela, passou a ser permitido que empresas terceirizem suas atividades principais, ampliando os contratos entre CNPJs. LEIA TAMBÉM: MEIs representam 79,5% das empresas abertas no primeiro trimestre de 2025 “Esse crescimento pode ser visto como um reflexo de um mercado de trabalho mais fragmentado e dinâmico. Na prática, o trabalhador assume o papel de empresário, incluindo em atividades que eram informais. E esse movimento nos fala tanto do espírito empreendedor quanto da necessidade de adaptação diante das transformações do mercado de trabalho”, pontua Giulia. A formalização de comércios, indústrias e serviços também é um dos fatores que explicam o aumento das MEIs . “Acho que as pessoas estão tendo mais acesso à informação, ao conhecimento, e estão se formalizando mais, seja através de sociedade limitada (LTDA), seja através do MEI. E o MEI, é claro, pela carga tributária ser menor, a tendência é ser a mais procurada para os pequenos negócios”, pontua. Entre os setores, foi o de prestação de serviços o que representou a maior parte do número total de abertura de novas empresas (73%), contra 19% de comércios e 8% de indústrias . De acordo com Giulia, é nele que se concentra a informalidade. E, nesse sentido, cita o ramo da logística como um segmento que pode ter contribuído para o crescimento na abertura de CNPJs. “De 2021 para cá a logística tem se destacado muito dentro da prestação de serviços. Principalmente, falando sobre a regulamentação da MEI caminhoneiro. Essa é uma legislação que tramitou no poder público por muito tempo e, finalmente, com a aprovação e regulamentação, trouxe uma parcela grande de motoristas autônomos de carga que viram vantagem nessa modalidade de empresa”, pontua a representante do Sebrae-RS.

author: Paul Byrne
title: Terrified family feared they'd die when Storm Gerrit tornado ripped house to pieces - Mirror Online
text:
A family yesterday told how they feared they were going to die as a tornado ripped their home to pieces.
Gareth and Lyndsey Moody and three of their children had a lucky escape when the twister struck shortly before midnight on Wednesday. They scrambled to safety over bricks, timber and slates after the tornado ripped off their roof and sent rubble plunging into their rooms. The home was one of 100 damaged in ­Stalybridge, Greater Manchester , as Storm Gerrit brought havoc to parts of the UK.
Three men died yesterday after a 4x4 vehicle they were in plunged into the River Esk near Glaisdale on the North York Moors The storm caused travel chaos with roads closed and ferries and flights cancelled, while 1,500 homes were still without power last night. Gareth and Lyndsey, both 45, were in bed when the twister hit.
Mum-of-four Lyndsey, an A&E nurse, said: “We were lucky to get out alive. We could be dead. The house started shaking. I went to the window, it was like it was sucking in and out. The whole ceiling came down. I screamed, the hallway gave way. The chimney came down and took out the rest of the house.”
Council licensing officer Gareth added: “I went downstairs and heard a loud crash. The lights went out and there was another loud crash. It was mayhem. I ran back upstairs and saw a huge hole in the landing.” Two of the couple’s sons, Jack, 22, and Thomas, 15, were in their bedrooms when the roof and chimney collapsed.
It smashed into Jack’s bedroom and destroyed the bathroom, flooding the kitchen. Gareth said: “How they are alive I don’t know. We were clambering over stuff to get out.” Daughter, Rebecca Saycell, 20, and husband Thomas, 27, were in their bedroom in the basement. They managed to flee with their dogs , Phoebe and Penny and cat Jessica.
Across Stalybridge the tornado ripped off roof tiles, uprooted trees, knocked down walls and sent debris flying into parked cars. Resident Peter Hall was shocked to find a tree had landed on the windscreen of his car. Hayley McCaffer, from the nearby village of Carrbrook, said: “Some of the houses are a disaster, the roof missing, gable ends gone, cars squished.” The Met Office said a “supercell thunderstorm” had caused the damage.
Lib Dem transport spokeswoman Wera Hobhouse urged Rishi Sunak to call a Cobra meeting to tackle the chaos in the area. Around 1,500 properties in ­ Scotland were still without electricity yesterday. Heavy snow, high winds and rain, downed power lines. Some households will not be reconnected until later today.
A string of train ­operators, including LNER and Avanti West Coast, suspended or axed services. Ferries between Dover and France were delayed and Heathrow Airport cancelled 18 flights on Wednesday. The fastest wind gusts were 86mph at Inverbervie, Scotland, 84mph at Fair Isle in ­Shetland, and 83mph at Capel Curig, North Wales. The Met Office warned of more strong winds and rain today and tomorrow. And police urged people in affected areas to only travel if necessary.

text:
Bitcoin: The Evolution, Impact, and Future of Digital Money
Introduction to Bitcoin: The Dawn of a New Monetary Era
The introduction of Bitcoin marked a turning point in the history of finance. Conceived in the aftermath of the 2008 global financial crisis, it introduced a decentralized type of money that bypasses conventional banking systems. The idea was easy yet advanced– produce a peer-to-peer network where value could be transferred straight between individuals without the requirement for intermediaries.
Bitcoin is a type of digital money built on innovative technology that relies on a decentralized ledger system. Unlike fiat currencies provided and managed by governments and reserve banks, Bitcoin operates on a dispersed network preserved by its users. This suggests there’s no single authority dictating its supply, policies, or rules.
In the beginning, Bitcoin was primarily a theoretical concept talked about amongst tech lovers. Today, it has actually become an international phenomenon affecting economies, governments, institutions, and individuals across the world.
The Origin Story: Who Created Bitcoin and Why?
Bitcoin’s origin is as mysterious as it is interesting. It was presented in 2008 through a white paper titled “Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System,” authored by an individual or group using the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto. To this day, the identity behind that name stays unknown.
The motivation behind Bitcoin was deeply rooted in frustration with traditional monetary systems. The collapse of major banks during the monetary crisis, coupled with federal government bailouts and monetary adjustment, sparked a desire for an option. Bitcoin was designed to provide individuals control over their own money and develop a system resistant to inflation and censorship.
Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first block– referred to as the Genesis Block– in January 2009. Embedded within that block was a recommendation to a heading from The Times paper: “Chancellor on brink of 2nd bailout for banks.” This subtle message was a clear sign of the political and financial commentary embedded in Bitcoin’s very structure.
How Bitcoin Works: A Look Under the Hood
To comprehend Bitcoin, one need to initially grasp the core technology that makes it work. At its structure lies a public journal called the blockchain. This ledger records all transactions in a transparent and tamper-proof method, accessible to anybody.
When someone sends out Bitcoin to another person, that deal is relayed to the network. Instead of being processed by a centralized bank, it is verified by nodes– computers dispersed across the globe running Bitcoin’s software application. These nodes validate the transaction’s validity based upon a stringent set of guidelines.
Deals are grouped into blocks, which are then added to the blockchain. This process is carried out by miners, who use computational power to solve intricate mathematical puzzles. Fixing these puzzles needs substantial energy and computing resources, however the benefit is worth it– miners get freshly created Bitcoin in addition to transaction charges.
The difficulty of the mining process is what makes Bitcoin secure. Altering a single block would need re-mining all subsequent blocks, a nearly difficult task due to the immense computing power it would take. This ensures the stability of the blockchain and makes damaging historical data practically unfeasible.
The Economics of Bitcoin: Scarcity and Supply
Among Bitcoin’s the majority of specifying functions is its repaired supply. Unlike conventional forms of cash that can be printed at will by reserve banks, Bitcoin has a hard cap of 21 million units. This suggests that no greater than 21 million Bitcoin will ever exist, a fact that sets it apart from every government-issued currency.
This restricted supply produces scarcity, a principle essential to economics. As demand increases and supply stays consistent or reductions (as occurs throughout periodic halvings), the worth of each system tends to increase in time. Halvings take place approximately every four years, lowering the variety of new Bitcoin released to miners by half.
This system mimics the scarcity of precious resources like gold. In fact, lots of people refer to Bitcoin as “digital gold” because of its fixed supply and decentralized nature.
As more individuals recognize Bitcoin’s scarcity and durability, demand continues to grow. Organizations, corporations, and private financiers are progressively assigning portions of their portfolios to Bitcoin as a shop of value, a hedge versus inflation, and an alternative to standard monetary instruments.
Bitcoin as a Medium of crypto exchange
While Bitcoin’s prospective as a shop of value has actually gotten considerable attention, its original intent was to operate as a legal tender. In its early years, enthusiasts used Bitcoin to buy products and services from merchants ready to accept it. The most well-known early transaction was the purchase of 2 pizzas for 10,000 Bitcoin– an event now celebrated as “Bitcoin Pizza Day.”
Gradually, Bitcoin’s functionality as everyday money has actually enhanced, thanks to advancements in payment facilities. Today, you can spend Bitcoin at an increasing variety of online and brick-and-mortar sellers. Some websites allow users to pay for airline tickets, hotel stays, electronic devices, and even food shipment.
To help with transactions, users need a safe digital wallet. One alternative for a free and easy to use wallet is Volet, which allows individuals to shop, send, and receive Bitcoin with ease. With a wallet like Volet, you hold your own private keys, giving you complete control over your funds without dependence on a bank or 3rd party.
In addition, platforms like Freebitcoin offer chances to earn complimentary Bitcoin, making it possible for newcomers to enter the area without initial investment. These tools are particularly valuable for instructional functions, assisting users learn how Bitcoin works by engaging with it directly.
Security and Privacy: Control in the Hands of the User
One of the main attractions of Bitcoin is the level of security it provides. Unlike standard checking account that can be frozen or taken, Bitcoin wallets are secured by cryptographic keys. If you manage the private secrets to your wallet, you have full ownership of your funds– no federal government or organization can interfere.
Bitcoin deals are likewise pseudonymous. Instead of connecting to your genuine name, deals are related to distinct addresses. While not totally anonymous, this structure supplies a layer of privacy that is not available with a lot of types of electronic payment.
Users should still take precautions, however. If you lose access to your wallet or share your personal secrets, your Bitcoin can be lost or taken. This places the problem of security on the individual, a double-edged sword that provides liberty however likewise obligation.
To mitigate danger, users frequently spread their holdings throughout multiple wallets and use freezer approaches– keeping their Bitcoin offline to avoid online threats like hacking or phishing. Lots of also utilize hardware wallets for added security.
The Global Impact of Bitcoin: Empowering the Unbanked
Bitcoin has the prospective to revolutionize access to monetary services worldwide. In areas where banking facilities is limited or where political instability undermines trust in nationwide currencies, Bitcoin offers a lifeline.
For the billions of people worldwide who are underbanked or unbanked, Bitcoin provides access to an international financial system utilizing just a mobile phone and a web connection. Without any requirement for ID confirmation or credit history, anyone can get involved.
In nations experiencing devaluation, residents have turned to Bitcoin to protect their wealth. In others, it’s used to bypass capital controls and remittance fees, permitting families to send out and get funds without losing a large percentage to intermediaries.
These use cases show Bitcoin’s capability to provide monetary inclusion on a scale formerly believed impossible. It breaks down barriers put up by geography, administration, and inequality.
Regulative Challenges and Legal Status
As Bitcoin has actually grown in prominence, federal governments and regulators around the world have actually taken notice. The decentralized nature of Bitcoin provides a difficulty to existing monetary systems that rely on centralized control.
Some countries have welcomed Bitcoin, incorporating it into legal frameworks or even embracing it as legal tender. Others have imposed limitations or straight-out bans, citing issues over cash laundering, scams, and the loss of control over financial policy.
The regulatory landscape is still evolving. In lots of jurisdictions, the legal category of Bitcoin stays unclear, causing confusion around taxation, licensing, and compliance.
Despite these challenges, the resilience of the Bitcoin network has proven powerful. Its decentralized nature makes it challenging to reduce totally, and brand-new developments in privacy tools, decentralized exchanges, and peer-to-peer procedures are making it even harder to manage.
Bitcoin and Institutional Adoption
The past couple of years have actually seen a remarkable shift in how Bitcoin is perceived by mainstream institutions. What was when dismissed as a fringe experiment has now been welcomed by Fortune 500 business, investment firms, and even governments.
Significant financial institutions are now providing Bitcoin-related services and products. Hedge funds and property supervisors are designating portions of their portfolios to it, treating it as a non-correlated property class. Public business are including Bitcoin to their balance sheets, signaling long-term belief in its worth.
Payment suppliers and online retailers are integrating Bitcoin payment options, offering customers more versatility in how they negotiate. These advancements suggest a growing recognition of Bitcoin’s legitimacy and potential to disrupt conventional finance.
This wave of institutional participation has brought brand-new liquidity, legitimacy, and presence to Bitcoin. It has actually likewise spurred regulative clearness and infrastructure enhancements, leading the way for even broader adoption.
Technological Developments and the Lightning Network
Among the most significant criticisms of Bitcoin has been its transaction speed and cost. As use grew, the network became busy, resulting in delays and higher charges.
To address this, designers introduced the Lightning Network, a second-layer protocol built on top of the Bitcoin network. The Lightning Network allows for instant, inexpensive transactions by making it possible for users to open personal payment channels with each other.
This innovation has dramatically enhanced Bitcoin’s prospective as a cash. Payments can be settled in seconds with practically no charges, making it ideal for microtransactions and daily usage.
The Lightning Network is still progressing, but it has already seen substantial adoption. Wallets and platforms are integrating Lightning capabilities, and merchants are beginning to accept payments through it. This development signals that Bitcoin is not simply a static possession however a dynamic system that can scale and adjust with time.
Environmental Concerns and Sustainability
Bitcoin’s energy consumption has become a hot topic in public discourse. The mining process, which protects the network, requires vast quantities of electrical energy– typically compared to that of entire countries.
Critics argue that this is environmentally unsustainable, while supporters compete that the energy usage is justified by the benefits of a decentralized monetary system. It’s essential to keep in mind that much of the energy utilized comes from renewable sources, especially in areas where green energy is plentiful and cheap.
Efforts are underway to enhance sustainability. Some mining operations are transferring to locations with surplus renewable energy. Others are checking out innovations like carbon balancing out, immersion cooling, and more energy-efficient mining hardware.
The discussion around Bitcoin’s environmental effect is continuous, and it has actually prompted crucial conversations about sustainability, development, and the compromises of monetary liberty.
Future Outlook: What Lies Ahead for Bitcoin?
Bitcoin is still in its early stages, regardless of being over a years old. It has made it through market crashes, regulatory crackdowns, internal disputes, and countless media obituaries.
As adoption continues to grow, brand-new usage cases will emerge. Decentralized financing, tokenized assets, and autonomous companies are already being built using Bitcoin as a foundation. The merging of expert system, blockchain technology, and monetary innovation is poised to redefine how we consider cash.
Mainstream adoption will likely continue, especially as facilities ends up being more user-friendly. Services like Volet make it easier than ever to manage digital money safely, while platforms like Freebitcoin aid onboard newcomers with minimal threat.
Eventually, Bitcoin is not simply a technology– it’s a motion. It represents a shift in how humans arrange financial relationships, distribute power, and define value. Whether you view it as a financial investment, a political declaration, or a tool for worldwide empowerment, its impact is undeniable.
Conclusion: The Revolution Is Already Here
Bitcoin has already altered the world. What started as an idea shared on an obscure subscriber list has become a global force with the power to reshape economies and obstacle institutions. It has empowered people, inspired innovation, and triggered a worldwide discussion about the nature of money.
As we move forward, the question is not whether Bitcoin will survive, but how we will adapt to a world in which it plays a progressively main role. For those who seek freedom, openness, and control over their monetary destiny, Bitcoin provides an engaging alternative.
Whether you’re just starting your journey or looking to deepen your understanding, there’s never been a better time to explore the world of Bitcoin. Open a complimentary wallet with Volet, make your first satoshi on Freebitcoin, and step into the future of finance– where money is no longer a tool of control, but a way of empowerment.
